business.headline: India bans land imports of more Bangladesh jute productsEarlier on June 27, India prohibited imports of a number of jute products and woven fabrics from Bangladesh through all land routes.

5 SIP myths that hurt investors more than markets, explains stock market expertMany investors blame market volatility for poor returns, but often, it's the myths they believe about SIPs that do more harm. Here's what an expert reveals.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

Field notes from building a billion-dollar luxury brandDiverse leadership isn't just good business, it's the future blueprint for luxury real estate success. Parisa Seif, Managing Partner at Kleindienst Group, writes

New Income Tax Bill 2025: Will changes in the revised bill impact taxpayers?The updated Bill, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on August 11, incorporates most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee. It is set to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961.

Sensex, Nifty rebound after falling in early trade; inflation data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points at the opening bell but swiftly recovered by 9:23 am. The Sensex was trading 10 points higher at 80,614.05, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 12.80 points higher at 24,597.85.

JSW Cement IPO allotment today: Check status online, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for JSW IPO can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the portal of KFin Technologies Limited.
Is it smart to use personal loan to fund your next trip?Most of the rise in holiday loans is from non-metro India. In 2025, 71% of borrowers came from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, up from 68% in 2023.

New Income Tax Bill approved: What's new after withdrawal of earlier draftThe original Income Tax Bill, 2025, was introduced on February 13 to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961. However, last week, the government decided to pull it back, saying the changes suggested by the Select Committee needed to be included in a fresh draft.

ICICI Bank raises minimum balance to Rs 50,000: What RBI governor saidICICI Bank has raised the minimum balance from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. In semi-urban branches, it has gone up from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000. In rural branches, the requirement is now Rs 10,000.

Air India to suspend Delhi-Washington direct flights from September 1Despite the halt of the direct Delhi-Washington service, Air India will continue offering one-stop flights to Washington via partner airlines Alaska Airlines, United Airlines, and Delta Air Lines.
Sensex ends 746 points up, Nifty above 24,500; Tata Motors gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 746.29 points to close at 80,604.08, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 221.75 points to end at 24,585.05.

Equity mutual fund inflows soar to record high in July. Check detailsNet flows into equity schemes rose 81% month-on-month to Rs 42,702 crore in July, data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) showed. Overall, assets under management in the mutual fund industry hit a record high at Rs 75.36 lakh crore.

Sensex gains 700 points: Why is stock market rising today?The rally was led by public sector banking and auto sector stocks. Banking stocks were in focus after State Bank of India (SBI) posted strong Q1 results, which prompted positive commentary from brokerages.

From health insurance and tax: 7 money-related myths decodedFrom health insurance and tax filing to investing and retirement planning, understanding the truth behind common myths can help you make confident, well-informed decisions for your future.

ITR-5 excel utility opens: What is it and who must fileIf filing physically, taxpayers must verify the return by sending the signed ITR-V form to the Centralised Processing Centre (CPC) in Bengaluru within 30 days, unless they choose to e-verify instead.

Why 'Make in India' still depends so much on China-made goodsWhen Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the 'Make in India' programme in 2014, it was meant to transform India into a global manufacturing hub, create millions of jobs, and reduce dependence on imports, especially from China.

From ban to profit sharing: Inside US deal with Nvidia, AMD on China chip salesThe deal makes the US a direct financial beneficiary of sensitive technology sales to a geopolitical rival. This article looks into the key details of this first-of-its-kind agreement.

ICICI Bank new minimum balance rules: FAQs, charges, and key informationIn metro and urban branches, the minimum average balance will jump from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. For semi-urban areas, it will increase from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000.

Borrowed cash from a friend? You may end up paying income tax penaltyThe income tax department is strict when it comes to large cash transactions. Whether it's taking a loan, repaying one, or even making donations, there are limits you need to follow. Go beyond those, and you could face a penalty equal to the entire amount involved.

BlueStone Jewellery IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe?The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 1.59 crore shares worth Rs 820 crore and an offer for sale of 1.39 crore shares worth Rs 720.65 crore.

SBI shares rise 2% over Q1 results. Should you buy?SBI share price: The rise came after SBI posted a standalone net profit of Rs 19,160 crore for the June quarter (Q1FY26), up from Rs 17,035 crore in the same quarter last year.

Voltas shares slide nearly 8% after sharp Q1 profit declineAt around 9:55 am, shares of Voltas were trading 5.86% lower at Rs 1,227.35.  The company reported a steep 58% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 140.6 crore, weighed down by unseasonal weather and subdued summer demand, which impacted air conditioner sales.

Sensex back above 80,000 as markets eye Trump-Putin meeting outcomeThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 157.26 points higher at 80,015.05 at 9:26 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 43.60 points to trade at 24,406.90. Most of the other broader market indices were mixed.

NSDL turns into a multibagger for investors: Will it continue to gain?Issued at Rs 800, the stock opened at Rs 880 and has raced to Rs 1,300.30, minting massive gains for early institutional investors and retail shareholders alike.

ICICI Bank hikes minimum savings balance to Rs 50,000: What it means for youThe change applies to all new accounts opened after that date, setting a new benchmark in the industry for the highest MAB requirement among domestic banks.

Ease of doing business: Piyush Goyal resolves Swiss firm's land issue in hoursUnion Minister Piyush Goyal resolved a complex land allocation issue for a major Swiss company during a live business conference, highlighting the ease of business in India.

Trump's tariff war: Is this India's 1991 moment? Montek Singh Ahluwalia exclusiveAt the Business Today India@100 Summit, Montek Singh Ahluwalia, former Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, discusses if the 2025 Trump tariff war presents a 1991-like moment for India.

Piyush Goyal exclusive: Whole world recognises India as fastest-growing economyUnion Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the Indian economy and said the whole world recognises us as the fastest-growing large economy.

'A win for India': Piyush Goyal on clinching UK free trade dealUnion Minister Piyush Goyal, speaking at the Business Today India@100 Summit, called the India-UK free trade deal a big win for the country.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

Nitin Gadkari dismisses concerns over ethanol-blended petrol as misinformationUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari firmly defended the government's ethanol-blended petrol initiative, stating that no complaints have surfaced about vehicle issues. Speaking at the India@100 Summit, he challenged critics to cite a single case of malfunction and accused them of spreading baseless misinformation.

entertainment.headline: Hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut approached for Bigg Boss 19: SourceThe makers of the much-awaited reality show 'Bigg Boss 19' have reportedly approached hip-hop duo Seedhe Maut. Having delivered songs like 'Raat Ki Rani' and 'Khatta Flow', Siddhant Sharma and Abhijay Negi have a massive fan following amongst Gen Z.

Not just Indian companies, Singapore firm announces holiday for Rajinikanth's CoolieTwo Singapore companies offered paid holidays for Tamil workers to watch Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'. Many Indian companies announced holidays on August 14 as well.

Coolie piracy blocked by Madras High Court, new order passed for Rajinikanth's filmMadras High Court intervenes to curb piracy of Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', ahead of its release, blocking ISPs and cable networks from streaming pirated versions. The court highlights that the producers will have to suffer an 'irreparable injury' if piracy persists.

Coolie advance sales skyrocket in US, Rajinikanth craze explodes in India'Coolie' has now achieved an unprecedented feat at the box office. The Rajinikanth starrer has registered a huge presence at the ticket window in the US, setting new records for Tamil cinema.

Nidhhi Agerwal denies role in using Andhra Pradesh government car for eventActor Nidhhi Agerwal clarified her non-involvement in using the Andhra Pradesh government car for an event. She explained that she had no role in it.

KBC 17: First contestant quits at Rs 50 lakh question on Rabindranath TagoreAmitabh Bachchan-hosted show, 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', kicked off on August 11. The first contestant on the hot seat failed to answer the Rs 50 lakh question.

Jolly LLB 3 teaser: Akshay-Arshad's courtroom clash turns into a laugh riot'Jolly LLB 3' teaser featuring Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi is finally out. The film is slated to release in theatres on September 19.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.

Kay Kay Menon says Congress misused his clip, denies role in 'vote chori' campaignActor Kay Kay Menon shared a post and denied his involvement in Congress's latest 'Vote Chori' campaign. He claimed that the political party used his clip without permission.

Coolie song Monica gets Monica Bellucci's stamp of approval. Pooja Hegde reactsPooja Hegde's song 'Monica' from the film 'Coolie' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj has now received praise from Monica Bellucci. The 'Retro' actor called it the biggest compliment ever.
Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's new podcast promo is pure romance. WatchTravis Kelce's podcast promo with Taylor Swift has left fans excited. The video will out on August 13 (ET).

My heart is full: Nick Jonas reflects on MetLife show, Priyanka says so proudSeveral artists, including Demi Lovato, took the stage with the Jonas Brothers, captivating the audience with their performances. Nick Jonas even shared an emotional note while thanking all for their love.

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.

Jennifer Aniston says Friends cast mourned Mathew Perry long before his deathActor Jennifer Aniston revealed the 'Friends' cast had been mourning former co-star Matthew Perry before his death in October 2023. She highlighted his tough battle with addiction and shared that he was healthy and happy before he died.

Actor Saurabh Sachdeva comments on Triptii Dimri's choices after Animal successTriptii Dimri experienced a mixed phase in her acting career with some hits and misses. Her 'Dhadak 2' co-star Saurabh Sachdeva recently reflected on her career choices.

Abhinav Shukla echoes Isha Talwar's claim: Shanoo Sharma told me I lacked sparkActor Abhinav Shukla responded to 'Mirzapur' actor Isha Talwar's post against YRF casting director Shanoo Sharma. Shukla shared that he was told by the casting director that he was good-looking but lacked spark.

Not Ahaan in Saiyaara, Arjun Kapoor did romantic bike wrap with Sonakshi firstAn old scene from Arjun Kapoor's film 'Tevar' has resurfaced on social media. Social media users drew parallels to a strikingly similar moment in the recent hit 'Saiyaara'. In the video, Kapoor can be seen pulling Sonakshi Sinha closer on a bike before driving off.

Fawad Khan–Vaani's Abir Gulaal skips India, to release worldwide on August 29The romantic drama 'Abir Gulaal', starring Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor, is slated for worldwide release on August 29, excluding India. It was earlier scheduled for a release on May 9.

For Rajinikanth's Coolie, Anirudh admits using ChatGPT to overcome creative blockMusic composer Anirudh Ravichander opened up about his experience of working on the songs for Rajinikanth's latest film, 'Coolie'. He revealed in a recent interview that he used artificial intelligence to overcome a creative block.

general news.headline: Cash row: Lok Sabha forms panel on proposal to impeach Justice VarmaLok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday accepted the motion signed by 146 MPs for the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge pile of cash was found.

In terror tag for Baloch group, Trump largess for Pak. Message for India?While the Balochistan Liberation Army has been behind several attacks in Pakistan, particularly targeting its military, what is significant here is the timing of the US announcement.

Woman alleges 9 fake votes registered from on address in BJP's lone Kerala seatA woman in Kerala's Thrissur alleged that nine fake votes were added using her address without her knowledge. CPM claims vacant flats in Poonkunnam were misused for voter list manipulation. Opposition leaders demand a probe into alleged BJP-linked irregularities.

Delhi-NCR stares at house help crisis amid exodus of Bengali migrantsThe corporate and IT hubs of Noida and Gurgaon, which house a large working-class population, run on migrant labour. A crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immihrants and fears of a Bihar-like special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal has led to a sudden exodus of Bengali migrants. Even as a humanitarian crisis unfolds, Delhi-NCR is staring at a domestic help crisis.

China plans railway line to India's doorsteps, sparks twin concernChina is set to build a massive railway line linking Tibet and northwestern Xinjiang, which reports say will pass near the LAC with India. Beijing's rail push, right through India's Aksai Chin, is expected to add to New Delhi's concerns. Beijing is planning a rail network up to the Nepal border, and the sensitive Chumbi Valley, the area of the 2017 Doklam stand-off.

Congress High Command sacked me: Ex-Karnataka Minister vows to expose conspiracyFormer Karnataka minister KN Rajanna said the Congress high command was behind his removal. He hinted at a conspiracy but promised details later. His ouster followed remarks on voter list lapses during Congress rule.

Ek BrahMos chalega: Mithun Chakraborty's reply to Bilawal Bhutto's war threatBilawal Bhutto escalated tensions, warning of war if India alters the Indus Waters Treaty, a day after Pakistani Army chief Asim Munir threatened nuclear retaliation and compared Islamabad's standing to a "dump truck" against New Delhi.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.
Field Marshal Asim Munir's Armageddon rantThe Pakistan Army chief has transformed himself into a vile, windbag provocateur threatening nuclear weapons use. Here's why the world must worry.

Can't kick India around: Ex-Pentagon official praises PM's tough stand on US tiesFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin said PM Modi's stance would mark the moment the US learnt it can't kick India around. He criticised Trump's position and warned that Pakistan has lost legitimacy over its nuclear threats.

How many more pits: Chaos in Karnataka Assembly as BJP slams Dharmashtala probeBJP members clashed with the Karnataka government in the Assembly over the Dharmasthala mass burial case investigation. They demanded interim probe updates and identity of the complainant. The Speaker deferred a detailed discussion to tomorrow.

Idle days, wild rumours: Kohli and Rohit deserve to decide ODI futuresFor all the noise about grey beards and holiday photos, the scoreboard still tells the truest story: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma remain match-winners in one-day cricket. The off-season may fuel idle speculation, but the final call on their ODI futures should rest with the men who've carried Indian cricket on their shoulders.

What are Animal Birth Control rules that court mentioned in its stray dog orderThe Supreme Court's order, as well as its criticism of the ABC Rules, which lay out norms for sterilisation of stray dogs, has received pushback from animal welfare activists and NGOs.

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

How to repay a Rs 1 crore home loan in under 10 years and save Rs 52 lakhThe joy of getting the keys to your home is unmatched, but the reality of a 20-year (or longer) home loan often brings with it a heavy financial commitment.

Lingering Fatigue, dizziness, weakness: The anemia crisis is striking urban womenAnemia is increasingly affecting urban women in India, as a result of changing diets and lifestyles and the rise of processed convenient foods.

How Modi outsmarted Trump, avoided photo-op trapUS President Donald Trump's Nobel Peace Prize ambitions have him collecting photos with warring world leaders. Last week, Trump turned "peacemaker" again and got Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev and Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan in a single frame. He's trying the same for Putin and Zelenskyy in Alaska. However, PM Narendra Modi outsmarted Trump and didn't fall into a photo-op trap with Pakistan's Asim Munir in June.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.
Chhattisgarh teacher admits turning up drunk in shorts to school 'on doctor's advice'A head teacher in Chhattisgarh arrived drunk at school and claimed medical advice required alcohol consumption.

Brothers of Destruction: How the relay team is driving India's athletics revolutionThe Indian sprinting group of Animesh Kujur, Gurindervir Singh, Manikanta Hoblidhar and Amlan Borgohain are breaking each other's records in the race to become the fastest man in India. But when they get together for the 4x100m relay, they become one — the Brothers of Destruction.

Put terror tag on Bishnoi gang: Canada Opposition after Kapil Sharma cafe attackCanada's Opposition party has urged Prime Minister Mark Carney to designate the India-based Lawrence Bishnoi gang a terrorist organisation. The demand follows recent attacks on comedian Kapil Sharma's Surrey cafe. Conservative MP and public safety critic Frank Caputo highlighted the gang's violent record and extortion threats targeting the South Asian community, saying a terror tag would empower law enforcement with stronger tools to tackle the group.

How much chai is too much? Rujuta Diwekar answersMorning wake-up call, breakfast companion, afternoon energy booster or an evening must-have, a cup of tea can mean so much to different people. It's an emotion but not without its price. Rujuta Diwekar shares tips for incorporating tea into a healthy lifestyle.

Top court asks all states to check, release convicts who've completed sentencesThe Supreme Court directed the Home Secretaries of all States and Union Territories to ascertain if any convict is remaining in prison beyond the period of sentence.

Vir Das, Janhvi Kapoor, other celebs react to Supreme Court stray dog orderBollywood stars have opposed the Supreme Court's order against stray dogs. Actors like Janhvi Kapoor and Varun Dhawan say, "Just no compassion left."
Allu Arjun greets paps with a smile at Mumbai airport. VideoActor Allu Arjun was recently clicked at the Mumbai airport. He smiled and greeted the paparazzi at the airport.

KBC 17: Officers Sofiya Qureshi, Vyomika Singh recount Operation Sindoor with Big BActor Amitabh Bachchan welcomed Col Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Commander Prerna Deosthalee in 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. The upcoming episode has been shot as an Independence Day special.

Not just Indian companies, Singapore firm announces holiday for Rajinikanth's CoolieTwo Singapore companies offered paid holidays for Tamil workers to watch Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'. Many Indian companies announced holidays on August 14 as well.

sports.headline: Jasprit Bumrah slammed by Azharuddin over workload claims: Can't pick and chooseFormer India captain Mohammed Azharuddin slammed Jasprit Bumrah for picking and choosing matches in the name of workload management. Bumrah played just three matches during the England tour.

Witnessed Mohammed Siraj's yorker from the best seat in house: Kumar DharmasenaUmpire Kumar Dharmasena recalled India's winning moment from the fifth Test against England at the Oval and said that he had the best seat in the house to witness Mohammed Siraj's yorker.

Kohli and Rohit made error in quitting Test cricket: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra believes that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma should have not retired from Tests, but could have hung up their boots in ODI cricket. He feels it will not be easy for the legendary duo to stay in groove amid lack of white-ball cricket.

Vidit Gujrathi holds Keymer, keeps title race alive in ChennaiVidit Gujrathi held leader Vincent Keymer to a draw in Round 5 of the Chennai Grandmasters Chess, keeping the title race alive as Arjun Erigaisi also shared points ahead of their table-topping clash on Day 6.

D Gukesh makes comeback to finish Day 1 of St. Louis Rapid and Blitz at thirdD Gukesh made a stunning comeback to finish Day 1 of the St. Louis Rapid and Blitz at joint-third on August 11. Gukesh lost the first match and then went on to win the next two to end the day with four points.

Cincinnati Open: Sinner beats Diallo, Fritz passes Sonego TestJannik Sinner registered a dominating win against Canada's Gabriel Diallo to keep his title defence alive. Taylor Fritz also made his way into the last 16 as he breezed past Lorenzo Sonego 7-6(4) 7-5.

Ashwin adds value to CSK, but not at his price tag: S Badrinath makes big claimS Badrinath has claimed that CSK should think about releasing R Ashwin, given his current price tag. Ashwin was bought for 9.75 crore rupees by Chennai during the IPL 2025 mega auction.

The off-season may fuel idle speculation, but the final call on their ODI futures should rest with the men who've carried Indian cricket on their shoulders.

Sarfaraz Khan eyeing Sunil Gavaskar's Kanga League script for India comebackSarfaraz Khan is embracing the monsoon grind of Mumbai's Kanga League, following in Sunil Gavaskar's footsteps, to sharpen his game and make a strong case for a Test comeback after his England series omission.

Emma Raducanu, chair umpire have hilarious exchange over crying baby at CincinnatiDuring her Cincinnati Open third-round clash with Aryna Sabalenka, Emma Raducanu was distracted by a crying child, leading to a hilarious exchange with the umpire. Raducanu lost the match against Sabalenka, despite a valiant effort.

Raducanu lost the match against Sabalenka, despite a valiant effort.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
